t: In*p the year that King Uzziah died, I saw the Lord seated on a high and lofty throne, and the hem of his robe filled the temple.
Seraphim were standing above him; they each had six wings: with two they covered their faces, with two they covered their feet, and with two they flew.
And one called to another: Holy,*pn holy, holy is the Lord*s of Armies; his*ln glory fills the whole earth.
The*p foundations of the doorways shook at the sound of their voices, and the temple was filled with smoke.
Then*p I said: Woe*pn is me for I am ruined because*ln I am a man of unclean lips and*ln live among a people of unclean lips, and*ln because my eyes have seen the King, the*ln Lord*s of Armies.
Then*p one of the seraphim flew to me, and in his hand was a glowing coal that he had taken from the altar with tongs.
He touched my mouth with it and said: Now*pn that this has touched your lips, your*ln iniquity is removed and*ln your sin is atoned for.
Then*p I heard the voice of the Lord asking: Who*pn will I send? Who*ln will go for us? I*p said: Here*pn I am. Send me.
And*p he replied: Go!*pn Say to these people: Keep*ln listening, but do not understand; keep*ln looking, but do not perceive.

Make*ln the minds of these people dull; deafen*ln their ears and blind their eyes; otherwise*ln they might see with their eyes and*ln hear with their ears, understand*ln with their minds, turn*ln back, and be healed.
Then*p I said, “Until when, Lord?” And he replied: Until*pn cities lie in ruins without inhabitants, houses*ln are without people, the*ln land is ruined and desolate,
and*ln the Lord*s drives the people far away, leaving*ln great emptiness in the land.
Though*ln a tenth will remain in the land, it*ln will be burned again. Like*ln the terebinth or the oak that*ln leaves a stump when felled, the*ln holy seed is the stump.
